snippet: The Westchester County district attorney’s investigation concluded that Corey Foster’s heart attack as he was being restrained by four staff members does not warrant a criminal case.
abstract: Westchester County district attorney concludes that no criminal charges are warranted in the death of Corey Foster, a 16-year-old boy who went into cardiac arrest while being physically restrained at Leake & Watts residential treatment center in Yonkers; Foster's parents plan to file a civil suit, charging that he had a heart ailment documented in his medical files.
lead_paragraph: The Westchester County district attorney’s investigation concluded that Corey Foster’s heart attack as he was being restrained by four staff members does not warrant a criminal case.

headline.seo: No Charges to Be Filed in Death of Corey Foster at Yonkers Treatment Center
headline.main: No Charges in Death at Yonkers Center for Youths
headline.print_headline: No Charges In a Death At a Center For Youths
